name: Lentil and Cactus Soup (Mom's Recipe)
author: ralph512
summary: This is an authentic Mexican recipe from Cueva Grande, Valparaiso, Zacatecas, Mexico. The only thing I changed was the addition of the potatoes.
ingredients: 1 pound lentils, picked over and rinsed
1 ½ tablespoons chicken bouillon (such as Knorr®)
¼ teaspoon ground cumin, or to taste
2 teaspoons chicken bouillon (such as Knorr®), or to taste
directions: Bring the water to a boil in a soup pot with 3 cloves of garlic
Stir in the lentils and 1 1/2 tablespoons of chicken bouillon
Simmer over medium-low heat until lentils are almost soft, about 1 hour
Heat extra-virgin olive oil in a skillet, and cook and stir the onion and 2 chopped cloves of  garlic until the onion becomes translucent, about 5 minutes
Add the tomato and continue to cook and stir until the tomato releases its juice, about 5 more minutes
Stir the tomato mixture into the lentil soup along with cumin and 2 more teaspoons of chicken bouillon, or to taste
Bring the soup to a simmer, stir in the nopales and potatoes, and cook over low heat until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes
